Как по мне игра привлекательна тем, что ты создаешь персонажа на свои ситуации или думать как лучше будет выглядеть так называемый "билд"(созданная "сборка" способностей). Вначале игра за одного персонажа, а затем за всех, получая при этом навыки других персов. Правда вот я могу даже выделить минусы:
- за маньяка матчи долго ищются
- после обновы стали появлятся ошибка после нажатия что ты готов к матчу и выкидывают в меню с "неизвестная ошибка"
- не знаю как у других, но после обновления у меня почему-то вылетает игра после каждого завершенного матча
Если по 10-балке, то ставлю игре с натяжкой 6 из 10. Дополнительных 2 очка за то, что хотя бы "справляется" со своей задачей: доказывает что деньги на DLC и саму купленную игру потрачены не зря(про донат даже не говорите. Тот ещё зашкар алочности разрабов...)

В принципе хорошие сервера в этой игре

Dead by Daylight is a game that can potentially be tons of fun, alone or with friends, but is often plagued by bugs and balancing issues, as well as a very 'difficult' community.

Dead by Daylight pits a team of four survivors against one killer. The survivors ultimate objective is to survive (duh) and escape, a goal they can accomplish by repairing five of seven generators places across the map to power the exit gates. The killers task is to stop them from accomplishing that goal and ultimately sacrifice the survivors to the Entity, a Lovecraftian evil power that hosts these little trials for its own entertainment. Survivors can assist each other and are encouraged to act selflessly to achieve a common goal. Survivors and killer gain points for completing relevant actions that bring them closer to success. This also means that, even though you may not have manage to escape, the game will recognise your positive efforts and contributions to the team and will not count the game as a classic loss. This allows you, at least to some degree, create your own objectives and play more loosely than with a super rigid goal. The earned points count towards a rating you receive after each match; this rating also affects your matchmaking rank, which is kept separate for your survivor games and killer games to ensure matches. Sadly, that idea doesn't work all too well in reality, with unfair match-ups being more common than what's acceptable.

The killers all play differently thanks to their unique powers. Apart from the basic attack, all killers offer abilites that transform matches into something that also feels like a different game. For example, The Trapper uses his bear traps to control a part of the map and will funnel survivors into his traps, forcing the other survivors to come for the rescue and thereby risking to get their own ankles caught in his beartraps. The Hillbilly can rev up his chainsaw and zoom across the map to dig his weapon into survivor's backs. The Wraith can turn invisible using a magic bell and suddenly re-appear behind unsuspecting survivors minding their own business, giving them a major fright. The roster of 18 killers consists of original creations, often inspired by media and folklore, as well as some licensed slasher and horror icons, including the likes of Halloween's Michael Myers, Texas Chainsaw Massacre's Leatherface, Nightmare on Elm Street's Freddy Krueger, Saw's Amanda, Scream's Ghostface and Stranger Thing's Demogorgon. It's very fun to be able to play these legends and take a took hit of fresh nostalgia. The survivors all play the same fundamentally, and only act as templates for your different builds and play styles. 

It's important to note that only a minor portion of the roster is available for free, and that most survivors and killers have to be bought from the store. If you play for a while, you also gain the ability to invest a special currency (earned slowly by leveling your account) into the non-licensed characters and unlock them permanently. It's a nice addition that rewards loyal and active players.

The most interesting part of the game is the perk system. All killers and survivors can use up to four perks that alter the gameplay in fun and surprising ways to suit your play style and improve your chances of success. Survivors can choose from a total of 71 perks, killers have 63 perks to chose from, a vast majority of which are locked behind DLC purchases. As it's always the case, the viability of some perks is much higher/lower than that of others, leading to certain "meta builds" that are highly advantageous compared to other perk compositions. That means, effectively, that only a handful of perks will consistently appear in the majority of load-outs of both killers and survivors, going as far as some perks being considered "absolutely essential" - most others remain situational and niche, while the rest are basically pointless unless you want to have a laugh or put yourself at a calculated disadvantage. 

Another feature that allows for gameplay personalisation is the choice of 'add-ons', which alter and/or improve the killers' abilities or, in the case of survivors, improve the functionality of items they bring into the trial with them. These items can be found in crates on the map or acquired through the bloodweb, which is a randomly generated web of items, addons, offerings and perks you have to invest your earned points into to level the individual characters. These items can help healing, speed up generator repairs, hinder the killer or help you escape.

Looking at all that, it's easy to see how some things get out of hand and issues arise. Balancing an asymmetric multiplayer game such as this is immensely difficult, therefor I can't really blame the devs for frequently over- or undershooting the mark and introducing features into the game that some would consider un-fun. Ever since the release, there have been loud discussions over the most minor details that allegedly favour the killer or the survivors too strongly. Changes were made, sometimes not enough, sometimes enough to get the other side riled up about their new disadvantages. Admittedly, the devs idea of fairness and fun seems to be weird in some regards, but overall they strive to create a fair and fun game and succeeded in doing so in a vast majority of attempts.

Speaking of riled up people, the community still has an issue with toxic and salty players that have their own, very specific ideas of how games should go. These ideas usually involve them winning effortlessly and the other side not fighting back at all. Some players come up with their own little rules about how the other side has to play the game. This frequently manifests in post-game shouting matches and insults being thrown in the chat. Since the game's release, the situation has improved lots thanks to community interventions and vocal ragers are rather rare until you arrive in the match-making higher ranks. Either way, they are easy to ignore and can be found in every competitive game.

---

Overall, Dead By Daylight usually is very enjoyable and fun, no matter if you're playing alone or with friends. There's lots of replayability due to tons of existing content and endless item/perk/addon/offering combinations. The game's devs are still very active and involved, with multiple new DLCs being released every year. The game is not dreadfully scary, but often has you clenching your butt and yelping in fear. Frequently discounted and even worth full price if you're into this type of game. I promise I'll stab you gently.

(技術型玩家)

給想玩"鬼"玩家的建議:
1. 不要對rank太認真, 人與鬼之間的平衡愈做愈差, 官方都愛削鬼不削AT
2. AT修機團修發電機的速度比鬼還快, 5分鐘內修好5台不是夢

給想玩"人"玩家的建議:
1.如不注重輸贏, 也是可以玩的。不過鬼發現你沒打頭(毀滅打擊), 隊友又不幫忙扛刀扛掛數的話, 基本上你可以很快上路了
2. 記著單排的時候, 隊友都是鬼


備注: 
1.  3000小時以上的人權, 人跟鬼都有玩 (0次燒斬(啊,忘了斬殺變垃圾了)上R1)
2.  我自己玩人都不帶道具, 不帶也好強勢了好不好

I'm gonna keep this short and concise: 

Pros; decent gameplay, alright visuals, atmospheric music, devs keep adding content.

Cons; Bugs and minor frustrations (such as hit boxes being out of place at times, sometimes as well you can get frozen in place when being put on a hook) Another problem I have is with the servers, there seems to be difficulty at times finding a game, also, you can experience lag. I have experienced frame rate drops at the start up and in game too. 

Do I recommend? Yes, but ONLY if you can tolerate the cons.
Fun game, Better with friends. I approve.

While this is a recommendation, I feel that this game has a long way to go before it can see big success. the game is oddly balanced.  90% of the time it's a sweep from either side due to a high ranked killer matching against brand new survivors (or vice versa).  The other 10% of the time the game feels fairly balanced.  The game is really a gamble when it comes to fun.  With a small group of friends, it can be wonderful, but in the long term, it's plagued by a grindy progression system, poor balance, and server issues.  I love BHVR, but I feel this game has a bit of time to go before it can be great.
